clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Occupational Therapy Intervention to Promote Preschoolers' Participation
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Controlled Study to Examine the Efficacy of Occupational Therapy Intervention to Promote Preschool Children's Participation

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the efficacy of Occupational Therapy intervention to promote participation in everyday occupation of preschool children with mild developmental disabilities.

detailed_description.textblock: Preschoolers suffering from mild developmental disabilities are being referred to Occupational Therapy (OT) clinics according to limitation in participating of daily occupations. As well these children often demonstrate behavior or emotional difficulties. The primary treatment goal is promoting participation yet many times the treatment focuses on child's performance skills and not on occupation based activities. Respectively its outcome measures are the child performance skills. This study will document the therapeutic intervention, and evaluate its impact on child participation as well on his performance skills and emotional aspects. Participants will be recruited from waiting list for Occupational Therapy at Clalit Health services, Child Development Institute and divided into 3 groups: one direct OT intervention and two control groups (waiting list and sensory-motor games).

primary_outcome.description: Improvement of Participation of daily occupation as measured with Child Participation Questionnaire (CPQ)

clinical_study.condition: Limited Participation in Daily Life Activities

arm_group.description: 9-12 guided sessions of sesory-motor training using video games

intervention.description: Short term individual occupational therapy (9-12 weeks)
Short term sensory-motor training using video games (9-12 weeks)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- kindergarten students of regular education
- Hebrew speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Students of special education
- Attending physiotherapy or psychology treatments
- Autistic Spectrum Disorder
- Cerebral Palsy
- Spina Bifida
- Developmental Intellectual Disabilities
- Blindness
- Deafness
